greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: Number of crossing set partitions of {1,2,...,n} into k blocks.
reference: R. P. Stanley, Enumerative Combinatorics, Vol. 2, Cambridge University Press, 1999 (Exericses 6.19)
formula: T(n,k) = S2(n,k) - C(n,k-1)*C(n,k)/n; S2(n,k) Stirling numbers of the second kind, C(n,k) binomial coefficients.
example: There are 10 crossing set partitions of {1,2,3,4,5}.
maple: for n from 1 to 9 do seq(A189232(n,k), k = 1..n) od;
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := StirlingS2[n, k] - Binomial[n, k-1] Binomial[n, k]/n;
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Apr 28 2011
